New Records: West Indies set a new unwanted record of 51 dot balls - the most any team has registered in a T20 World Cup when posting a score of at least 180.
Key Match Events: Phil Salt scored 87 not out, leading England to victory.
Jonny Bairstow scored an unbeaten 48, supporting Salt in a 97-run stand.
Adil Rashid took 1 for 21 from his four overs, restricting West Indies' batters.
Rovman Powell hit five sixes in his innings, scoring 36.
Jofra Archer removed Nicholas Pooran, contributing to England's win.
Andre Russell was dismissed by Adil Rashid.
Sherfane Rutherford scored 28 from 15 deliveries, helping West Indies reach 180.
Roston Chase ended the opening stand by trapping Jos Buttler in front.
Phil Salt hit Romario Shepherd for 30 runs in one over, the joint-most expensive over by a West Indian in a T20 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: Phil Salt expressed happiness about Jonny Bairstow taking the pressure off him by taking calculated risks.
West Indies coach Sammy stated that the loss will not dampen their spirits.
Jos Buttler praised Jonny Bairstow's mature innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a fine batting deck at the Daren Sammy National Stadium.
Jofra Archer consistently bowled around the 90mph mark.
England's win set a marker for the rest of the teams in the Super Eight of the T20 World Cup 2024.
